comments:
- Run latest ATF code on WTP RC5
- Create a new Rico project
- An error dialog appears that says "org.mozilla.javascript.Undefined"
- The error log shows this stack trace;

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.mozilla.javascript.Undefined
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSLintValidator.lint(JSLintValidator.java:145)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSLintValidator.validateString(JSLintValidator.java:100)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateFile(JSAbstractValidator.java:243)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateContainer(JSAbstractValidator.java:371)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateContainer(JSAbstractValidator.java:374)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateContainer(JSAbstractValidator.java:374)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateFull(JSAbstractValidator.java:357)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validate(JSAbstractValidator.java:122)
at org.eclipse.atf.javascript.internal.validation.JSAbstractValidator.validateInJob(JSAbstractValidator.java:76)
at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidatorJob.run(ValidatorJob.java:70)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
This problem has gone away with the latest code in the trunk and WTP1.5.
